title: "Give up tons of farm and wait for late game" is the most unfun "counterplay" imaginable.
body: The most frustrating thing about top lane for people who don't play the role often are fucking "lane bullies". Champions like {{champion:58}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:126}}  whom essentially make you feel like you're playing from behind the moment the laning phase starts because they will blow your ass up the moment you attempt to step to a minion near them. If you didn't counterpick them directly for one reason or another, you have to just hang back like a bitch and fall behind in farm until the late game comes and these champions fall off on their own. It's honestly downright emasculating to have fucking Renekton sit his fat scaly ass on top of your waves free farming while you give up minion after minion just because he is there. It ends up being a test of how much you can take before you get frustrated and try to eke out a cannon minion at the wrong moment.

Why should someone stop playing a champion because Riot refuses to balance their game?

Would should I not have fun playing who I want and follow Riot's enforced meta just to win?

This is my opinion, but if you're playing a champion that doesn't win lane against most match-ups, then you shouldn't complain about not being able to win lane.

The role of tanks and juggernauts are to be able to do their duties of soaking damage and/or dealing damage come late game. To balance this out, they must have a weak early game. Champions like Renekton, Pantheon, and Jayce are all really good early/mid game, but their damage seems to fall off late game when more items get completed on the enemy team, especially the tanks. 

In short, you can play whichever champion you want. It becomes a problem when you want your champion to not have a critical weakness that balances them.

Irelia really isn't a lane bully in the same sense as the others. She's actually super weak very early on, she can't even threaten anything until level 2 unlike every other champ you listed and she has no way to outrade until level 3 and even then her trades tend to be quite weak until she has points in W. Really Irelia starts to come online at around level 5-6 when she gets a Sheen or a Phage, significantly later than all the other actual lane bullies you mentioned.

Riven can't threaten anyone until level 2 or 3, Renekton needs level 2, Pantheon takes until level 2 or 3 to become threatening (until then, even his spears don't do much to you), Jayce doesn't do much to you until level 2 or 3, Quinn only bullies you because range versus melee...

No champion is threatening at level 1, except for the rare exceptions of someone like Blitz.

>Riven can't threaten anyone until level 2 or 3

Her Q and passive alone can deal upwards or 250 damage at level 1, she's definitely threatening at lv 1.

>Renekton needs level 2

He can however outrade anyone with his Q and easily gain that early level 2 with his AoE.

>Pantheon takes until level 2 or 3 to become threatening (until then, even his spears don't do much to you)

>Jayce doesn't do much to you until level 2 or 3, 

>Quinn only bullies you because range versus melee...

I'm just going to handle all 3 of these together because they do the same thing, they use the threat of ranged damage to zone you while having a backup to make sure they outrade if you aggress on them. Panth has his shield, Jayce has an extra spell and his absurd melee passive damage and Quinn just E's back.

All of these champs have strengths that allow them to start winning lane at level 1, Irelia on the other hand does not. Her spells are janky on their own, if she starts Q she can force but never outrade, if she starts W she can outrade but never force and if she starts E she can turn aggro but not really force or outrade unless the enemy goes far too aggressive into her. Even at level 2 this problem persists. She absolutely needs all of her spells to function, unlike the other champs listed and her spells have a lot of power in the /lv portion (other than Q) which leads to her hardest powerspikes being at levels 5,7,9,13 and Triforce, which by the way is a terible item to try to bully with because the stats on the components just can't compete with something like a Serated Dirk and the complete item comes super late compared to a Black Cleaver.

I don't think it matters which way you cut it, Irelia's really not a lane bully. Sure she can bully certain stupid picks into her like Yasuo but the majority of champs who go top aren't pressured super hard by her early.

Riven's gameplay design is a fucking embarrassment. Q cooldown starting from the time of its first cast means she can keep it on an effective 1 second cooldown and harass forever because she's manaless.

Her shield is on a similarly absurd cooldown and lets her take 2-3 tower shots. Keep in mind {{champion:78}} had her shield nerfed dramatically because it was "free," in conjunction with courage of the colossus, which later got nerfed itself, leaving her just plain fucking weaker than before the mastery was introduced. But Riven? Nah let's let her get an empowered auto attack attached to a dash and a shield for no mana cost and on a 10 second cooldown. We'll also let this defensiveoffensive skill scale with ONE HUNDRED PERCENT bonus AD so she doesn't even have to build defensively to make the most of it. Oh and it goes down to a 6 second cooldown with rank.

We'll also give her a knockup to invalidate tenacity, and a stun that can be linked from that knockup before it finishes so her opponent has no way of countering the followup R slash. And that stun will also scale with ONE HUNDRED PERCENT bonus AD.



It's honestly disgusting. Being a manaless character should come with drawbacks in either phase-specific damage gating, longer cooldowns, vulnerable downtime on missed skills, or fragility. Instead Riven is a lane bully and a hypercarry simultaneously, has virtually nonexistent cooldowns, escape options for days if she mispositions, and a reliable, repeatable shield on top of otherwise still average defenses.

Even if you do play the Role often, it still feels that way.

Then again, I main {{champion:83}} , so it's not like I shouldn't expect it.
